file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0000.mp4
text: The illustration below shows the graph of y as a function of x.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0001.mp4
text: So that's this graph right over here.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0002.mp4
text: And then they start to ask us some questions.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0003.mp4
text: Complete the sentences based on the graph of the function.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0004.mp4
text: So this axis is our y-axis, the vertical axis.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0005.mp4
text: Horizontal axis is x-axis.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0006.mp4
text: Initially, as x increases-- so let's think about it.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0007.mp4
text: Initially, so when we start from x equals 0 and x is increasing, what's happening to y?

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0008.mp4
text: Well, y is decreasing.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0009.mp4
text: So y decreases.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0010.mp4
text: So as x increases initially, y decreases.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0011.mp4
text: The slope of the graph is equal to blank for all x between x equals 0 and x equals 3.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0012.mp4
text: So x equals 0 and x equals 3, what's the slope?

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0013.mp4
text: Well, every time we move 1 in the x direction, we move down in the y direction.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0014.mp4
text: We go negative 1 in the y direction.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0015.mp4
text: Move up 1 in the x direction, we go negative 1 in the y direction.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0016.mp4
text: So our change in y over our change in x-- our change in y is negative 1 whenever our change in x is 1.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0017.mp4
text: So our change in y over our change in x, which is the definition of slope, is negative 1/1.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0018.mp4
text: So it's negative 1.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0019.mp4
text: And we see that.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0020.mp4
text: Every time x increases by 1, y decreases by 1.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0021.mp4
text: Starting at x equals 3, y blank as x increases.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0022.mp4
text: So starting at x equals 3, y increases as x increases.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0023.mp4
text: As x increases, y is increasing.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0024.mp4
text: So y increases as x increases.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0025.mp4
text: The slope of the graph is equal to blank for x between 3 and 5.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0026.mp4
text: So when x increases by 1, y is increasing by 3.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0027.mp4
text: So change in y is 3, change in x is 1.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0028.mp4
text: Slope is change in y over change in x, which is 3/1.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0029.mp4
text: So the slope here is 3.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0030.mp4
text: Every time x increases by 1, y increases by 3.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0031.mp4
text: For x between x equals 0 and x equals 4, y-- let's see, we can pick less than or equal to, greater than or equal to, or equal.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0032.mp4
text: So for x equals 0 and x equals 4, y is less than or equal to 0.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0033.mp4
text: So let's do less than or equal to 0.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0034.mp4
text: And then they say, for x between x equals 4 and x equals 8-- well, then y is greater than or equal to 0.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0035.mp4
text: So let's make sure that we didn't make any careless mistakes here.

file_name: ./clip_video/Interpreting a graph exercise example ｜ Linear equations and functions ｜ 8th grade ｜ Khan Academy [YyjpeoxdUXc]/videos/clip_0036.mp4
text: Let's check our answer.
